rows.S41: RESEARCH DESIGN: The experiment. What we're testing, how we measure it, what we expect to find.
RESEARCH QUESTION
Can a sufficiently detailed coordination artifact (the Trade), combined with an AI co-pilot
(Claude), replace centralized management in venture creation?
Sub-questions:
1. Can flash teams of strangers produce expert-grade work from tabs alone?
2. What is the information loss rate when coordination is artifact-mediated vs. human-mediated?
3. Does the quality of output (expert grades) degrade as the founder's involvement decreases?
4. What emergent behaviors arise that weren't designed into the system?
5. How does AI co-piloting (Claude) affect flash team productivity and quality?
HYPOTHESIS
H1: A coordination artifact of sufficient detail (100+ TUPs with structural tabs) can
coordinate 40-60 flash contributors to produce expert-grade output (mean grade B or above)
with zero centralized management after initial conditions are set.
H2: Information loss (measured by questions tabs couldn't answer) will decrease over time
as gaps are filled, approaching zero by Week 8.
H3: Output quality will NOT degrade as founder involvement decreases, because the artifact
contains the founder's judgment, not the founder.
H4: AI co-piloting will reduce production time per TUP by 40-60% compared to
unassisted flash contributors (measured in contributor-reported hours).
METHODOLOGY
Design: Longitudinal case study with embedded quantitative measurement.
Unit of analysis: The TUP (Trade Unit Project). N = 103.
Population: 40-60 flash contributors across 18 clusters, 3 levels.
The experiment IS the IonWave Trade production cycle. We're not running a separate
experiment â€” we're instrumenting the actual production process to capture research data.
Data collection is embedded in the librarian's workflow. No extra effort for contributors.
The MC conversations are qualitative data (recorded, transcribed).
The V-tabs are quantitative data (expert grades per TUP).
VARIABLES
Variable
Expert grade per TUP
Hours per TUP
Questions per TUP
